pl.bristleback.server.bristle.api

Interface WebsocketConnector<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractConnector

    public interface WebsocketConnector<T>
    Websocket connector is an abstract representation of single client connection. Object implementing this interface has physical implementation of network socket as well as other information, like used sub protocol (in Bristleback it's one of the DataController interface implementation) or connection id number.

    Created on: 2011-07-14 16:39:33

    Author:
    Wojciech Niemiec

      void setWebsocketVersion(String version)
      Sets version of WebSockets protocol used by this connection.
      void stop()
      Physically disconnects client, releasing all resources used by this connection and invoking ServerEngine.onConnectionClose(WebsocketConnector) method.

    • Method Detail

      • getDataController

        DataController getDataController()
        Gets DataController used by client represented by this connector. Data controller (sub protocol, according to WebSockets specification) is chosen by client when connecting.
        Returns:
        data controller used in connection.

      • getConnectorId

        String getConnectorId()
        Gets connection ID number.
        Returns:
        connection ID number.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Physically disconnects client, releasing all resources used by this connection and invoking ServerEngine.onConnectionClose(WebsocketConnector) method.

      • getEngine

        ServerEngine getEngine()
        Gets Server Engine used.
        Returns:
        server engine.

      • getWebsocketVersion

        String getWebsocketVersion()
        Gets version of WebSockets protocol used by this connection.
        Returns:
        WebSockets version.

      • setWebsocketVersion

        Sets version of WebSockets protocol used by this connection.
        Parameters:
